Package soot.jimple.infoflow

Class InfoflowConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.InfoflowConfiguration
  • public class InfoflowConfiguration
extends Object
    Central configuration class for FlowDroid
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.AccessPathConfiguration
      Class containing the configuration options for dealing with access paths (maximum length, reduction options, etc.)
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.AliasingAlgorithm
      Enumeration containing the aliasing algorithms supported by FlowDroid
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.CallbackSourceMode
      Methods for deciding whether a parameter of a system callback is to be treated as a source or not
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.CallgraphAlgorithm
      Enumeration containing the callgraph algorithms supported for the use with the data flow tracker
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.CategoryMode
      The modes (included or excludes) that a category can have for the data flow analysis
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.CodeEliminationMode
      Enumeration containing all possible modes of dead and irrelevant code elimination
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.DataFlowDirection  
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.DataFlowSolver
      Enumeration containing the supported data flow solvers
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.ImplicitFlowMode
      Enumeration containing the supported modes how the data flow analyzer shall handle implicit flows
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.LayoutMatchingMode
      Possible modes for matching layout components as data flow sources
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.OutputConfiguration
      Class that defines settings for writing out the FlowDroid results
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.PathBuildingAlgorithm
      Enumeration containing the supported path builders
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.PathConfiguration
      The configuration that defines how FlowDroid shall handle between sources and sinks
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.PathReconstructionMode
      Supported modes for reconstructing paths between sources and sinks.
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.SolverConfiguration
      Class containing the configuration options for the IFDS data flow solver
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.SootIntegrationMode
      Enumeration containing the different ways in which Soot can be used
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.SourceSinkConfiguration
      The configuration for the source and sink manager
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.SourceSinkFilterMode
      The default mode how the filter shall treat source or sink categories that have not been configured explicitly
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.SparsePropagationStrategy
      Enumeration containing the options for the SparseContextFlowSensitive solver
      static class  InfoflowConfiguration.StaticFieldTrackingMode
      Enumeration containing the supported techniques for handling taints on static fields

      • merge

        public void merge​(InfoflowConfiguration config)
        Merges the given configuration options into this configuration object
        Parameters:

      • setPathAgnosticResults

        public void setPathAgnosticResults​(boolean pathAgnosticResults)
        Sets whether results (source-to-sink connections) that only differ in their propagation paths shall be merged into a single result or not.
        Parameters:
        pathAgnosticResults - True if two results shall be regarded as equal if they connect the same source and sink, even if their propagation paths differ, otherwise false

      • getPathAgnosticResults

        public boolean getPathAgnosticResults()
        Gets whether results (source-to-sink connections) that only differ in their propagation paths shall be merged into a single result or not.
        Returns:
        True if two results shall be regarded as equal if they connect the same source and sink, even if their propagation paths differ, otherwise false

      • getOneResultPerAccessPath

        public static boolean getOneResultPerAccessPath()
        Gets whether different results shall be reported if they only differ in the access path the reached the sink or left the source
        Returns:
        True if results shall also be distinguished based on access paths

      • setOneResultPerAccessPath

        public static void setOneResultPerAccessPath​(boolean oneResultPerAP)
        Gets whether different results shall be reported if they only differ in the access path the reached the sink or left the source
        Parameters:
        oneResultPerAP - True if results shall also be distinguished based on access paths

        public static boolean getMergeNeighbors()
        Gets whether neighbors at the same statement shall be merged into a single abstraction
        Returns:
        True if equivalent neighbor shall be merged, otherwise false

      • setMaxThreadNum

        public void setMaxThreadNum​(int threadNum)
        Sets the maximum number of threads to be used by the solver. A value of -1 indicates an unlimited number of threads, i.e., there will be as many threads as there are CPU cores on the machine.
        Parameters:
        threadNum - The maximum number of threads to be used by the solver, or -1 for an unlimited number of threads.

      • getMaxThreadNum

        public int getMaxThreadNum()
        Gets the maximum number of threads to be used by the solver. A value of -1 indicates an unlimited number of threads, i.e., there will be as many threads as there are CPU cores on the machine.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of threads to be used by the solver, or -1 for an unlimited number of threads.

      • isTaintAnalysisEnabled

        public boolean isTaintAnalysisEnabled()
        Gets whether the taint analysis is enabled. If it is disabled, FlowDroid will initialize the Soot instance and then return immediately.
        Returns:
        True if data flow tracking shall be performed, false otherwise

      • setTaintAnalysisEnabled

        public void setTaintAnalysisEnabled​(boolean taintAnalysisEnabled)
        Sets whether the taint analysis is enabled. If it is disabled, FlowDroid will initialize the Soot instance and then return immediately.
        Parameters:
        taintAnalysisEnabled - True if data flow tracking shall be performed, false otherwise

        public boolean getAdditionalFlowsEnabled()

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        additionalFlowsEnabled - True if additional flows shall be enabled

      • getFilterConditionalSinks

        public boolean getFilterConditionalSinks()
        Gets whether conditional sinks should be filtered if the condition was not met. If false, conditional sinks won't be filtered.
        Returns:
        True if conditional flows will be filtered

      • setFilterConditionalSinks

        public void setFilterConditionalSinks​(boolean filterConditionalSinks)
        Sets whether conditional sinks should be filtered if the condition was not met. If false, conditional sinks won't be filtered.
        Parameters:
        filterConditionalSinks - True if conditional sinks should be filtered

      • getIncrementalResultReporting

        public boolean getIncrementalResultReporting()
        Gets whether the data flow results shall be reported incrementally instead of being only available after the full data flow analysis has been completed.
        Returns:
        True if incremental data flow results shall be available, otherwise false

      • setIncrementalResultReporting

        public void setIncrementalResultReporting​(boolean incrementalReporting)
        Sets whether the data flow results shall be reported incrementally instead of being only available after the full data flow analysis has been completed.
        Parameters:
        incrementalReporting - True if incremental data flow results shall be available, otherwise false

      • getDataFlowTimeout

        public long getDataFlowTimeout()
        Gets the timeout in seconds after which the taint analysis shall be aborted. This timeout only applies to the taint analysis itself, not to the path reconstruction that happens afterwards.
        Returns:
        The timeout in seconds after which the analysis shall be aborted

      • setDataFlowTimeout

        public void setDataFlowTimeout​(long timeout)
        Sets the timeout in seconds after which the analysis shall be aborted. This timeout only applies to the taint analysis itself, not to the path reconstruction that happens afterwards.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout in seconds after which the analysis shall be aborted

      • getMemoryThreshold

        public double getMemoryThreshold()
        Gets the threshold at which the data flow analysis shall be terminated. If the JVM consumes more than this fraction of the heap, no more data flow edges are propagated, and the results obtained so far are returned.
        Returns:
        The threshold at which to abort the workers

      • setMemoryThreshold

        public void setMemoryThreshold​(double memoryThreshold)
        Sets the threshold at which the data flow analysis shall be terminated. If the JVM consumes more than this fraction of the heap, no more data flow edges are propagated, and the results obtained so far are returned.
        Parameters:
        memoryThreshold - The threshold at which to abort the workers

      • getOneSourceAtATime

        public boolean getOneSourceAtATime()
        Gets whether one source shall be analyzed at a time instead of all sources together
        Returns:
        True if the analysis shall be run with one analysis at a time, false if the analysis shall be run with all sources together

      • setOneSourceAtATime

        public void setOneSourceAtATime​(boolean oneSourceAtATime)
        Sets whether one source shall be analyzed at a time instead of all sources together
        Parameters:
        oneSourceAtATime - True if the analysis shall be run with one analysis at a time, false if the analysis shall be run with all sources together
